ai-ud8.1:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud8.1:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.
ai-ud8.1:1.4_0: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
ai-ud8.1:2.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.1:3.1_0: “There is, mendicants, that dimension where there is no earth, no water, no fire, no wind; no dimension of infinite space, no dimension of infinite consciousness, no dimension of nothingness, no dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; no this world, no other world, no moon or sun.
ai-ud8.1:3.2_0: There, mendicants, I say there is no coming or going or remaining or passing away or reappearing.
ai-ud8.1:3.3_0: It is not established, does not proceed, and has no support.
ai-ud8.1:3.5_0: First the first part of the body.
